text.section: The Director may apply to a judge of the District Court or a circuit court for a search warrant to enter the approved dwelling of an offender in the program to search for the offender.

An application for a search warrant shall:
be in writing;
be verified by the applicant; and
describe the premises to be searched and the nature, scope, and purpose of the search.

A judge who receives an application for a search warrant may issue a warrant on a finding that:
the scope of the proposed search is reasonable; and
obtaining consent to enter the premises may jeopardize the attempt to take custody of the offender.

section.section: A search warrant issued under this section shall specify the location of the premises to be searched.
A search conducted in accordance with a search warrant issued under this section may not exceed the limits specified in the warrant.

text.section:
A search warrant issued under this section shall be executed and returned to the issuing judge:
within the period specified in the warrant, which may not exceed 30 days from the date of issuance; or
within 15 days after the warrant is issued, if no period is specified in the warrant.
